* The payment at that time was 50c for each <span class="highlight">child</span> except the first <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* In 1941 the federal basic wage was based on an amount deemed to be sufficient for a man, his wife and 3 children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The judge in his wisdom said that he considered the basic wage was sufficient only for a man, wife and one <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* increase in the basic wage unless <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment was introduced. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* So it can be readily seen that over a period of 7 years from 1941 to 1948 during the war years and early post-war era 2 Labor governments were responsible for doubling <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment despite the fact that the basic wage had increased by only $4 over that period. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* In 1950 the Menzies Government introduced the payment of 50c for the first <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* In January 1964 the Menzies Government' increased the payment for the third <span class="highlight">child</span> by 50c from $1 to $1.50 and the payment for each successive <span class="highlight">child</span> by the same amount. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* In 1967 the Holt Government increased the payment by 25c from $1.50 to $1.75 for the fourth <span class="highlight">child</span> and by 50c from $1.50 to $2 for the fifth <span class="highlight">child</span> with a further 25c added for each successive addition to the number of children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Yet the endowment of 50c for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> has not been adjusted for 21 years and the endowment for the second <span class="highlight">child</span> of $1 for 23 years. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Despite the increases in this legislation, 85 per cent of endowed families, that is, in the first <span class="highlight">child</span> and 2 children categories, will not receive any increase at all. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* In most cases the increases to those familes with 3 or more children will be a welcome benefit. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The major cause of this decline has been the failure of the Government to increase the rates for the first and second children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* As Commonwealth statistics show, those families in the lower income brackets have the highest number of children, but many parents today are hesitant about having larger families simply because they cannot afford to do so. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* I re-emphasise that the initial step is to increase the payments for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> arid second <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* <span class="highlight">Child</span> endowment, a measure first introduced by the Liberal-Country Party Government as was generously recognised by the honourable member for Sydney  (Mr Cope),  has been increased for third and subsequent children, so that a family with 3 children receives a total income supplement of $2.50 a week while a family with 4 children receives $5.75. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* On this side of the House we have always believed that particular help should be given to families with children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Increases in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment for the third and subsequent children will [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* In the Budget there were great increases in the <span class="highlight">child</span>'s allowance so that $4.50 a week will be paid for each <span class="highlight">child</span>, representing an increase of $2 for the first and $1 for subsequent children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* For instance, a widow with 3 dependant children will receive a total payment of $38.25, or $45 if she had 4 dependant children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The special attention that is being given to assistance to families with children stands as a key feature of the social services programme. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Even if we do not increase any pensions, unemployment benefits, maternity benefits or <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment, each year we would see an increase in the expenditure on social welfare simply because our population is forever increasing and because the number of people who are eligible for those benefits is increasing, So it is just futile and fatuous to talk about record expenditures. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Fifthly, the rate of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment for the third and each subsequent <span class="highlight">child</span> under 16 years of age in a family is to be increased by 50c per week. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Sixthly, the rate of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment for each <span class="highlight">child</span> under 16 years of age in an approved institution is to be increased by 50c per week. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Finally, children's allowances for age, invalid and widow pensioners and for unemployment and sickness beneficiaries will increase by $2 per week for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> and by $1 per week for each other <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* This will bring the allowance to a uniform $4.50 per week for all these children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* There are 683,000 age pensioners who will receive $40,300,000; 119,000 invalid pensioners who will receive $7,300,000; 76,000 widow pensioners who will receive $4,400,000; 5,000 long term sickness pensioners who will receive $300,000; 31,000 in the classification of wives of pensioners and beneficiaries who will receive $1,700,000; and 155,000 children of pensioners and beneficiaries who will receive $12m. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The increase in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment will cost about $26,500,000 and will benefit 1,020,000 children in about 610,000 families. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The Government has neglected its responsibility in regard to <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment for the first <span class="highlight">child</span>; also the unemployment benefit. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Other items in the Social Services Act such as the wife's allowance and allowances for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> of pensioners have gone as long as 9 years without any increase, with a total increase of only $2.35 over  a  period of 20 years, or an average of 12c a year. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* As for <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> and the second <span class="highlight">child</span>, the maternity allowance and the funeral benefit, it is anybody's guess as to how many years will elapse before we see any alteration in those items. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* <span class="highlight">Child</span> endowment for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> has not increased during the past 21 years. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* This obviously means, if we look at past performances, that pensioners can forget about any further increases in <span class="highlight">child</span> allowance for at least the next 3 years, or even perhaps for the next 7 years. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Mothers can forget about any further increase in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment for at least 5 years, and perhaps 8 years. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* They can forget altogether, about the possibility of any increase for the first and second <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* I say this because the Minister referred to an overall plan and because the last increase for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> of a pensioner was in 1968, and before that in 1961. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* For the second, and other children the last increase was in 1969, and there was a period between 1963 and 1968 when there were no increases given at all. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* With regard to <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment the increase now proposed for the third <span class="highlight">child</span> is the first since 1964 and, for the fourth <span class="highlight">child</span>, since 1967. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* As the increase in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment this time applies only in cases where there are more than 2 children in a family and as the amount is only 50c, at a time when the Government places emphasis on children's needs, it must be pretty obvious that any increase daring the next 4 years or so will be very small indeed, if there is any increase at all. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* In 1949 <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment paid to a family with 3 children - which is close to the number of children in the average family - represented 11.3 per cent of the average male earnings. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Under this Budget, a family with 3 children will receive $3.50  a  week in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Average male earnings are now $88.50 a week, so <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment represents less than 3.95 per cent of average male earnings. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* A comparison with the minimum wage also shows how the value of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment has dropped over the years. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* In 1948 when the minimum wage was $11.60 a week, a family with 5 children received $4 a week in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* To retain the same relationship <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment now should be over $11 for a family with 5 children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The increase in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment does not make up for the loss Of purchasing power through inflation over the years, .lust recently Professor Ehrlich criticised the increase in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment not because the amount was insufficient but because the increase might result in more children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* If a couple had more children as a result of this miserable increase in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment, they would be gluttons for punishment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* lt is interesting to analyse how the family income shrinks as extra children come along. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* A married man without children pays $4.15 a week in income tax. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The first <span class="highlight">child</span> arrives and the tax is reduced to $3.40 a week. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The couple receive 50c a week <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment, which gives the family $43.40 a week, or $14.47 each. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The second <span class="highlight">child</span> comes along, the tax is reduced to $2.85 and they get $1.50 a week <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* With the third <span class="highlight">child</span>, tax paid weekly is $2.40 and <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment is $3.50 a week, leaving the family income at $47.40, or $9.48 for each unit. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* With the fourth <span class="highlight">child</span> taxation is reduced to $1.95 each week and <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment is $5.75 a week, making the family income $50.10, or $8.35 for each unit. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The examples that I have given deal with the big majority of families, because 75 per cent of all families have less than 4 children, leaving 25 per cent with 4 children or more. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The Government's failure to increase <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment for the first and second <span class="highlight">child</span> is to be deplored. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The effect on the family budget when the first <span class="highlight">child</span> reaches the age of 16 years is most noticeable. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The 50c a week <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> is taken away, and the endowment for the second <span class="highlight">child</span> is reduced to 50c a week, from $1 a week, making a loss of $1 a week in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The payment to the third <span class="highlight">child</span> is reduced from $2 to $1 a week making a loss of income of $2 a week. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Funeral benefits for pensioners amounts to $40 where a pensioner is responsible for the funeral costs of a spouse, a <span class="highlight">child</span> or another pensioner. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* From the inception of maternity allowance in 1912 until this Government came into office, the allowance would always pay the expenses associated with the birth of a <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Consequently, married couples are putting off having children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Both parents have to go to work in most cases in order to get their home together before having a <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

*  <span class="highlight">Child</span> endowment for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> was the basis of great election programmes and promises by the Liberal Party in 1949. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* <span class="highlight">Child</span> endowment for 3 children under 16 years of age represented 11.3 per cent of average male earnings in 1949. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* I want to deal briefly with the position of pensioners' children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* There is at the moment no way in which a pensioner's children can adequately be provided with a norma) education. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* 1 believe that if a person qualifies for a pension, especially an invalid pension, and has young children, some scheme should be evolved whereby his children can be provided with the wherewithal to obtain the education to which they are entitled and which is within their capacity to receive. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* We prolong the poverty cycle by forcing children to become self-conscious of the fact that they cannot participate in a normal manner in the affairs of their school because of the incomes of their parents. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* We prolong the cycle by creating a second class student in denying children of pensioners the normal opportunities. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* 1 wonder what a pensioner's <span class="highlight">child</span> thinks when the rest of the school, especially if it is a high school, is coming to Canberra to have a look at Parliament House, which I would hope would be a part of their education, but because of the costs involved the <span class="highlight">child</span> cannot have that part of his education. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* It is also true to say that in most oases the children of pensioners are forced to leave school at an earlier age, unless they are extremely lucky, because of the incomes of their families and the economic circumstances in which they find themselves. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* They are in fact denied the normal opportunities of other children in the community because of the economic circumstances of their parents. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* I believe it should be a high priority item on any government's agenda to ensure that these children are given the same opportunities as other children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

*  I would not seek to answer the honourable member for Corio  (Mr Scholes)  in detail, but I will take up one of the last points he made in relation to the children of pensioners. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* If there is anything which this Budget has done and if there is anything which the Minister for Social Services  (Mr Wentworth)  has sought to do it is to increase very significantly the children's allowance. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

[[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* But children have always been a necessity of life, and this is something of which this Government has continuously taken account. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* I do not make any apology for the fact that the Bill now before us is <span class="highlight">child</span> oriented. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* It enables me to remind the House that in Chifley's time virtually no allowance was made for children at all. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The children of widows received nothing extra at all. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Also, there was only a meagre allowance for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> of age and invalid pensioners and none for the others; and then an allowance was given only when the age pensioner was an invalid. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* We have given an allowance of $4.50 for every <span class="highlight">child</span> in this category. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* Furthermore, we have put on for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> in the shape of a mother's allowance an extra pension of S4 if the <span class="highlight">child</span> is over 6 years of age and $6 if there is a <span class="highlight">child</span> under 6 years of age. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* If we look at the family endowment and mothers allowance together, for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> there is an extra payment of $9 and if there is more than one <span class="highlight">child</span> it is about $7 per <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* The Labor Party has said that children have not got votes. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* We know that children do not have votes but we do think in terms of the children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-29-0)

* I want to  address  the House tonight on a matter which I consider to be of the utmost importance to every man, woman and <span class="highlight">child</span> in Australia. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710909_reps_27_hor73/#debate-32)

* I direct a question to the Minister for Labour and National Service relating to the continued inactivity by the Government on its undertaking given during the Senate election campaign to establish or assist <span class="highlight">child</span> minding centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1971/19710910_reps_27_hor73/#subdebate-4-0)

* For the last 15 months this Government has had before it the report of a Senate inquiry into the welfare of mentally and physically handicapped children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* It is a standing disgrace that 15 months after that report was tabled nothing has been done about these children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* If it is necessary for the ordinary, normal <span class="highlight">child</span> to have pre-school education opportunities I say categorically that it is even more urgent and demanding that intellectually and physically handicapped children should have that opportunity, not only for the sake of the children but also for the mental health of their unfortunate parents. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* Hungary, for instance, for the first 3 years of a baby's life a mother is paid to stay at home if she wishes to look after her <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* In Austria a mother is paid to look after her <span class="highlight">child</span> for the first year after its birth. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* This is a comprehensive, early childhood education programme for disadvantaged pre-school children and their families. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* It is a comprehensive programme to look after children and their families in deprived areas. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* The average assistance as at October 1970 was $1,050 per <span class="highlight">child</span> in a full year. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* When we start providing that kind of help for disadvantaged pre-school aged children in Australia we will have a social revolution. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* America provides $1,050 per <span class="highlight">child</span> in each full year. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* Since 1964 in the United States, more than 3.5 million preschool children have had the opportunity of education simply because of that 'head start' programme. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* Victoria can also be congratulated on the commendable percentage of children attending pre-schools in that State compared with every other State in Australia with the exception el Tasmania. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* In February of this year Victoria also instituted an inquiry into preschool <span class="highlight">child</span> development. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* These existing levels cater for something slightly in excess of one-sixth of the children who should be attending pre-school centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* The council is subsidising kindergartens to the extent of $1 to $1.50 per head, and the children's parents are paying fees ranging from $12.50 to $14 a quarter for their children to attend kindergarten. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* I have had personal experience of it costing parents more to send a <span class="highlight">child</span> to kindergarten than it did to send a <span class="highlight">child</span> to the first year at State school. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* We should have been told that Australia can and must eliminate poverty in the midst of plenty, can and must give every Australian <span class="highlight">child</span> an equal start in life by providing proper pre-schooling and raising the standards in the State and parish schools to some sort of equality with the wealthiest schools and by training the teachers we need. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* Take pre-schools - in this Budget there is a paltry effort to redeem in 1972 the promise made by the former Prime Minister, the right honourable member for Higgins  (Mr Gorton),  for kindergartencumchildminding centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* Because of its refusal a whole generation of Australian children is growing up without the enormous benefits that pre-school education brings. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* Yet only in Canberra, where the Commonwealth cannot escape its responsibility, can every <span class="highlight">child</span> enjoy at least 1 year's pre-school training at properly equipped, properly staffed centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* This was the time to start the expanded programme of pre-school teacher training required to give every Australian <span class="highlight">child</span> proper pre-schooling - the time to open a new world to a whole generation of Australian children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* Australia possesses only 28 per cent of the number of qualified pre-school teachers required to give every <span class="highlight">child</span> in every State the same start as every <span class="highlight">child</span> in Canberra has long enjoyed. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* This was the time to put purchasing power in the hands of Australian families by restoring the value of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment or introducing family endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* Whether a family includes one young <span class="highlight">child</span> or 4 young children, it is still a one-income family. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* We have as a prime objective the; eradication of poverty, and in heading in that direction we have record spending increases in housing, health, pensions, <span class="highlight">child</span> care, and repatriation. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* On current rates of unemployment benefit, a single adult person receives only $17 a week, a married couple receives $25 a week, and $4.50 is added for each dependent <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* Accordingly, assuming the payment of rent in each case, an unemployed man, his wife and 2 children are together expected to live on $4.50 a week less than a married pensioner couple alone. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* A man, his wife and 3 children are together expected to live on exactly the same amount. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720822_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-34-0)

* Let us examine the question of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* There are 4 million children in Australia today who will be receiving <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* The average endowed family represents 2.18 children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* Endowment for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> was introduced at 50c in 1950. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* Endowment for the second <span class="highlight">child</span> was introduced in 1948 at $1 and those figures have not been changed since that time. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* My point - let any Government supporter contradict me if he can - is that only one <span class="highlight">child</span> in 11 has benefited by the marginal, minimal paltry increases that have been given over the last 20 years. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* In 1949, the average amount of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment paid to a family was $90; today it is $104. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* This is a time when the Government is denying elementary justice to pensioners and to children in the form of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment, when it is denying responsibility for the system of education other than paltry, arbitrary subsidies given to the wealthy private schools and a time when it is denying proper responsibility for hospitalisation. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* But who has had to look after the children while she has been working? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* They are being looked after by one of the <span class="highlight">child</span> minding centres in Canberra - the Christopher Robin Centre. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* There is no harm in naming it That centre looked after her children for $25 a week. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* That amount out of this young couple's income went on <span class="highlight">child</span> minding expenses. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* But they should also have cheap housing and proper public transport so that they could live and at the very least have those <span class="highlight">child</span> minding expenses which are incurred so that she can go to work allowed as a taxation deduction. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* This year the Government will spend $53m in direct aid to 144,000 Aborigines, which amounts to about $370 a head, .man, woman and <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* A family of 5 - that is, with 3 children - have, in addition to the benefits and entitlements of all Australian citizens, an average expenditure on them of $1,850. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* In the Northern Territory, 75 per cent of Aboriginal children of preschool age are in such schools. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* Over 90 per cent of Aboriginal children of primary school age are so enrolled. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* A $1 a week increase in the rates of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment would have been of much more value to the families of Australia than the increase of $52 a year in the allowable deduction for each dependant of the taxpayer. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* The essential point is: What is the true policy of the Australian Labor Party and how will it affect every man, woman and <span class="highlight">child</span> in this country in the future? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720823_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-32-0)

* I am pleased to note that the Minister has seen the need to give special attention to married women wishing to re-enter the work force after having passed their most fertile <span class="highlight">child</span> bearing period so that they can come back into a work force which has changed very much from what it was 10 years earlier when they left to commence their <span class="highlight">child</span> bearing activities. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-23-0)

* There are major improvements also in relation to health, housing, <span class="highlight">child</span> care, social services and repatriation. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* The <span class="highlight">child</span> allowance for a civilian widow is $4.50 and for a war widow it is $7.35. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* This means that the civilian widow receives, including the allowance for one <span class="highlight">child</span>, a total of $28.50 and the war widow receives a total of $35.85. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* It costs as much to feed, clothe and educate the children of civilian widows as it does in the case of the children of war widows. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* Unemployment benefits remain at $17 for a male plus $8 if he has a wife and $4.50 if he has a <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* A married man with 2 children would receive $13 below the recognised poverty line under this arrangement. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* Maternity allowances have remained unaltered for 29 years although costs associated with the birth of a <span class="highlight">child</span> have risen 500 per cent. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* <span class="highlight">Child</span> endowment for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> has remained unaltered for 22 years and for the second <span class="highlight">child</span> for 24 years. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* Families with 3 children in 1949 secured in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment a sum equal to 11.5 per cent of average weekly earnings. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* Today a family of the same size receives in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment a sum which is less than 4 per cent of average weekly earnings. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* In 1948 the basic wage was $11.60 and a family with 5 children received in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment $4 a week. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* In 1949 a man with a wife and 2 children, On the minimum wage, paid $1.60 a year in income tax. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* This financial year the Commonwealth will collect from each man, woman and <span class="highlight">child</span> in Australia about $59 in sales tax, which is more than $1 each a week. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* Sales tax more than swallows up the 50c <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment for the first <span class="highlight">child</span> and $1 for the second <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* I believe that the acceptance of the principle of <span class="highlight">child</span> minding centres does the Government great credit. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* The proposal is that working mothers will have places where their children can be properly cared for while they work. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* The <span class="highlight">child</span> minding centres proposal was part of a policy speech during the 1970 Senate election campaign. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* I will have no time to say anything about the education or the repatriation proposals, the <span class="highlight">child</span> care proposals or the housing proposals. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* The right honourable member for Higgins  (Mr Gorton)  this afternoon was quite elated that there was a provision in this Budget for <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* How many children will that look after? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* The fact is that mothers who go to work have been most anxious and demanding that they should be allowed the cost of accommodating their children in <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres, $8, $10 or $12 a week - as a taxation deduction. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* For example, a person with a wife and one <span class="highlight">child</span> receiving $4,000 a year will have his tax reduced by $104.15. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* The same is true of concessional deductions for a wife and <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* I refer to civilian widows with children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* Also, one should keep in mind that nearly half the women on the A class widow's pensions - that is, civilian widows with children - are deserted wives. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* Yet the Government has given an A class widow an increase in pension of only $1.75 a week without any increase for her children, let alone an increase in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* In other words, a woman could have 6 children but, under this Budget, the only increase she will receive will be $1.75 a week. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* The Budget also does nothing to help the family by way of increases in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* As I have said before in this House, my electorate contains more young children than any other electorate in New South Wales, and probably, Australia. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* Couples with young families are struggling to raise their families and I know that their main demand in social welfare is an increase in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* This is the only way in which mothers who wish to stay home to tend to their children can do so and not be forced to go out to work when they do not want to. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* Why has this injustice - the refusal of the Government to update the value of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment - been perpetuated? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* The Budget provides $5m for <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres which mainly is to be allocated to centres catering for one parent families. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* Most children in the Australian Capital Territory can obtain pre-school education, whilst those in the various States cannot, except in a few centres run by voluntary organisations which are operating at present. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* As I said before, my electorate has more children in it than any other area of the State of New South Wales. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* Pre-school education - a great necessity to fit a <span class="highlight">child</span> psychologically for the adventure of primary school - is not available to the vast majority of children in my electorate. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* In view of the background I have given I ask the Minister responsible to provide in the Mount Druitt Housing Commission area the first <span class="highlight">child</span> care centre to be established by the Commonwealth. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#debate-27)

* I turn to <span class="highlight">child</span> care. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* In this Budget $5m is appropriated to provide accommodation and training for specialised staff to deal with the children of low income and special need families as well as the children of working parents who must leave their <span class="highlight">child</span> ren, sometimes in the care of friends or relations or sometimes without care at all. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* Very often these children get into real trouble. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* My attention was directed to one gang of these children aged between 7 and 11 years who, roaming around on their own, robbed an old man who was lying on the grass of more than $100. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* On another occasion, at the other end of my electorate, a similar gang of children used a shanghai to kill a prize cat in someone's back yard. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* On another occasion, another gang of children speared some fowls through a fence. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* These children were roaming around with nothing to do and had no-one to take care of them. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* This has been an increasing social problem and I look to this scheme to be of great assistance in the bringing up of these children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* It is the family man who suffers most from increases in the cost of living, and the larger his family the more he suffers - not only financially but also in a general way, because it is a great strain and worry to him if he is unable to provide his children with the start in life to which every <span class="highlight">child</span> should be entitled. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* He could be helped by way of increased <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment, which is real money and which is not taxable. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* Then there is assistance in regard to the education of his children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* The burden of providing an adequate education for their children is a greater burden to those taxpayers in the far flung and remote areas of the Commonwealth than for families resident in the city. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* This is quite natural, because of transport and accommodation costs which are involved when the <span class="highlight">child</span> is obliged to attend a school in the metropolitan area or in some city or town some distance from his real place of residence. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720824_reps_27_hor79/#subdebate-29-0)

* The Commonwealth should be making specific grants to the States for the specific purpose of assisting the parents in distant places who have children who are obliged to obtain an education away from home or if the parent decides to provide the education by way of a governess. * In the process there is a denial of the basic right of a <span class="highlight">child</span> to assistance merely because that <span class="highlight">child</span> goes to school. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-0)

* It is given because that <span class="highlight">child</span> goes to a school. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-0)

* Judge whether the parents of a <span class="highlight">child</span> at a parochial school would accept the Leader of the Opposition with his permissive policies as being appropriate for them. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-0)

* We could not judge that he would have any sympathy concerning their children or the other children of Australia. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-0)

* Yet Government supporters then say: 'Is this not a good thing because the poor underprivileged children in those Catholic schools will be encouraged to go on in this inadequate situation and thereby save the Government money.' [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-0)

* It is the worst thing for any government to suggest that it will exploit children on the basis of religious adherence and that it will thus save itself some money. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-0)

* We are saving the Government money by keeping these children in the other schools'. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-0)

* It would be far better and more honest to say that if the children are in these schools, they should get what they need. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-0)

* Nearly every <span class="highlight">child</span> who is going to a parish or regional Catholic school suffers a basic disadvantage because he is in an over-crowded classroom and the facilities are inadequate. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-0)

* What clause 13 means as it stands at the present moment is that for many of the very wealthy private schools this will provide another fillip by which they can increase their standards over the standards enjoyed by the children at the least wealthy private schools and those children who are attending government schools. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-1)

* Education in Australia takes place in a very competitive context, and every dollar of assistance that is provided to one school as opposed to another gives a very distinct advantage to the <span class="highlight">child</span> who goes to that school over the other. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-1)

* Let us just think about how well accommodated, well staffed, well equipped and well endowed schools such as Sydney Grammar School, Melbourne Grammar School, Geelong Grammar School, Xavier College and some of the other wealthier schools are already and how well placed their children are to get the maximum benefit out of the nation's education resources. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720927_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-25-1)

* Under Placitum (xxiia): Maternity allowances, widows' pensions, <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment, unemployment . [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720928_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-57-1)

* During this initial period of  6  months, assistance is  a  State matter and is also closely related to <span class="highlight">child</span> welfare responsibilities and functions which are solely  a  prerogative of the States. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19720928_reps_27_hor80/#subdebate-57-1)

* This Bill gives effect to the announcement by the Treasurer  (Mr Snedden)  in his Budget Speech on 15th August last of the Government's intention to bring down legislation concerning <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* This Government initiative is a tangible expression of its very real and proper concern for the welfare of children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The purpose of the legislation is to ensure the development of <span class="highlight">child</span> day care facilities of good quality throughout the Commonwealth. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Included in the concept good quality' are both the physical arrangements and the professional staffing, in the provision of which the overriding consideration will be the emotional, intellectual and physical development of children in <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Its work has included an investigation relating to needs in <span class="highlight">child</span> care, particularly the needs of working mothers. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Its studies covered developments in the field of <span class="highlight">child</span> day care in most other industrialised countries. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Further research programmes instigated in my Department and elsewhere subsequently indicated the parameters of the problem of <span class="highlight">child</span> day care. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Most importantly, they revealed that <span class="highlight">child</span> care facilities had not kept pace with the rapid growth in the female labour force during the 1960s, and that, as a consequence, existing <span class="highlight">child</span> care facilities were inadequate, qualitatively and quantitively, for the growing numbers of children needing them. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Not only were there too few centres but in many cases the provision was only for <span class="highlight">child</span> minding and not for the quality of <span class="highlight">child</span> care appropriate to the educational, emotional and developmental needs of the young children involved. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* During this examination the committee had the benefit of consultations with State government departments and with representatives from a wide range of local government, professional and voluntary groups and organisations throughout Australia concerned wilh day care arrangements for children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* These consultations revealed among other things, that <span class="highlight">child</span> care which was beneficial to the <span class="highlight">child</span>'s overall development was prohibitively costly for the large body of parents, and secondly, that the childminding arrangements that most parents could afford fell far short of the quality that was required in the interests of <span class="highlight">child</span> welfare. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* While many working mothers were able to make satisfactory arrangements for their children during working hours, a substantial number were not, partly because of a shortage of <span class="highlight">child</span> care facilities and partly because of the cost. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* It became evident that only through Government action could the problems that had developed in relation to <span class="highlight">child</span> care be met within an appropriate time scale. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* In summary, the Government decided that action was urgently needed; action to ensure sufficient good quality <span class="highlight">child</span> care facilities in the community for the proper care and development of pre-school aged children whose parents or guardians are unable, for a variety of reasons, to make other suitable arrangements. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* These facilities should be available at a cost that is not prohibitive to parents, especially to parents of children in special need. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* It is important to acknowledge that this initiative comprehends assistance at 3 levels - that of the <span class="highlight">child</span>, of the family, and of the community. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* For that reason there will be no static approach to the concept of <span class="highlight">child</span> care. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The scheme is forwardlooking and includes provision to stimulate research into all factors relating to the needs of the community in relation to the care of children, and for experiments in various <span class="highlight">child</span> day care methods. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* First, it is the view of authorities concerned with <span class="highlight">child</span> care - for example the <span class="highlight">Child</span> Psychiatry Section of the Australian and New Zealand College of Psychiatrists - that alternate care, provided for young children while their mothers are working, which is inadequate and unsatisfactory, can contribute to emotional disturbance in the <span class="highlight">child</span>'s later years. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Of particular concern is the situation where young children are left in the care of untrained and unsupervised <span class="highlight">child</span> minders who do not have the facilities conducive to the social and emotional development of young children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Unfortunately, many young children are being taken care of in just such circumstances. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Second, the Government's initiative springs from its concern for the welfare of children of working mothers. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* It is also a fact that at present 25 per cent of mothers with children under 6 years of age are in the labour force. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* That a substantial number of such mothers cannot make satisfactory arrangements for the care of their preschool aged children is yet another fact. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The purpose of the scheme is to meet this existing problem - to help the children of working and other parents insofar as they are deprived of proper <span class="highlight">child</span> care either because good quality facilities are not available or because the cost is presently too high. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* In summary, the Bill provides for assistance to non-profit organisations, including local governing bodies, to establish and operate centres which provide day care for children of working and sick parents and which give priority of admission to children in special need. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* For this purpose children in special need are defined in clause 20 of the Bill. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The proposed scheme has 4 main elements, as follows: (i) capital grants; (ii) recurrent grants in respect of qualified staff; (iii) recurrent grants with respect to children in special need; and (iv) grants for research and evaluation of matters relating to <span class="highlight">child</span> care. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* In summary, unmatched capital grants will be provided and made payable direct to eligible organisations for: (i) the purchase, erection, extension or alteration of buildings, including necessary fixtures, and land cost, for use as a <span class="highlight">child</span> care centre; and (ii) the purchase and installation of equipment for use in <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The Government regards unmatched grants as the most effective method of ensuring that sufficient new <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres will be built where they are needed most, particularly in areas of greatest social need. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Provision in the Budget of funds for capital grants in this financial year should enable a substantial expansion of the number of <span class="highlight">child</span> care places in the community. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* It is hoped to establish some 50 new centres catering for some 3,000 <span class="highlight">child</span> care places in the first full year of the scheme. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* This would provide an increase of about 20 per cent in the number of <span class="highlight">child</span> care places available in Australia, lt is a significant first step, and the Government intends that at least this rate of growth will be sustained in subsequent years. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* For its application for an unmatched capital grant to succeed, a claimant organisation will be required to demonstrate that it is capable of efficiently managing a <span class="highlight">child</span> care centre, and that it can bear the responsibility of ensuring the centre's financial viability. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* In all cases, the acceptance of a capital grant will automatically involve responsibility for running the <span class="highlight">child</span> care centre in accordance with the required conditions which I shall deal with later. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* There is provision for recurrent grants to eligible organisations to encourage the employment of certain types of qualified staff in specified numbers in <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Where there are 15 or more children 3 years of age or over enrolled full-time, the grant will be in respect of one pre-school teacher. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* After the first 20 children 3 years of age or over, the grant will be in respect of one qualified nurse for every 20 children or part thereof. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* There is provision for grants in respect of additional pre-school teachers in <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres accommodating more than a prescribed number of children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Younger children under 3 years of age have other and more demanding needs. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The grant will be available for a qualified nurse employed in a centre for every 10 such children or part thereof for which the centre has enrolments. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The number of children in this context refers to children enrolled for 8 hours during the day in a centre. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The Bill includes provision for the calculation of the grant to be made in such a way as to take into account the varying hours that different children might attend centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Thus, under the scheme opportunities will exist for children aged between 3 and 5 years in <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres to receive pre-school education. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Firstly, setting of standards for the employment of qualified persons in <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres is a function of State or local governments. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The Bill provides for special recurrent grants to enable centres to offer reduced fees in respect of enrolled children from low income and other families in financial need. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* There have been suggestions from time to time thai attendance at <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres should be free. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The fees normally charged to parents of children not in financial need will bc of the order presently being charged in the community. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* For these fees, however, children will enjoy in government-assisted centres a quality of care superior to that otherwise available because of the nature of the facilities and the qualified staff provided. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The basis of the method will be that an organisation operating a centre will receive payments with respect to children in special need. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* For this purpose, 'children in special need' is defined in the Bill - Clause 12 - as children of one parent families, of families in the first 3 years of settlement in Australia, of families where one of the parents is sick or incapacitated, and of families eligible to receive assistance under the subsidised health benefits scheme. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The level of the grant paid to organisations operating centres in respect of each <span class="highlight">child</span> in special need may be up to some $8 per week per <span class="highlight">child</span> under 3, and some $6 per week per <span class="highlight">child</span> 3 years of age and over. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The maximum rate per hour of attendance per <span class="highlight">child</span> that may be paid to an organisation will be prescribed by regulation. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The circumstances of families placing children in <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres cannot be predicted in advance. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* In a scheme of this nature, that relates to the development and care of children, every opportunity must be made to ensure that organisations assisted can operate their <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres with compassion and with the capacity to assist the most needy cases as they arise from time to time. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* At the same time, it will be the responsibility of organisations operating centres to balance their own financial budgets, taking into account the recurrent grants that will be made available - both in respect of staffing and with respect to children in special need - the fees they can collect, and their other sources of income, if any, against their outgoings for salaries, maintenance of equipment and buildings and other current expenditure. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* At present in Australia there are some 80 <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres operated on a nonprofit basis. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* In respect of these grants the scheme will come into operation when the <span class="highlight">Child</span> Care Act receives royal assent. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* to provide <span class="highlight">child</span> care on such days and during such hours as the Minister determines. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The intention of the first of these conditions is to ensure that preference in admission is given to those in greatest need of <span class="highlight">child</span> day care. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Organisations Li receipt of grants will be required to operate the <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres concerned for the benefit of the community in which they are located and generally to the satisfaction of the Minister. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* It will, of course, be obvious to honourable members that organisations seeking capital grants will have to demonstrate to the satisfaction of the Minister that a need for the new or additional <span class="highlight">child</span> day care facilities exists. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The Bill provides for a <span class="highlight">child</span> care standards committee to be established to advise the Minister on the range of facilities that will be covered by the unmatched capital grants to organisations, on the standard of these facilities and on the service provided in <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres in receipt of grant. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* In considering appropriate facilities and their standard the committee will, of course, have regard to the standards for <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres required by State legislation. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The committee may also be asked to advise on other matters referred to it in connection with the <span class="highlight">child</span> care scheme. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The <span class="highlight">child</span> care standards committee wil! [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* I hope that it will be possible to include officers of relevant State government departments who can advise on the facilities that should be provided, on the best approach to the development of children in centres, and as to the geographical areas that are in greatest need of additional <span class="highlight">child</span> care facilities. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The Government intends to ensure that developments in its provision for <span class="highlight">child</span> care continue to have regard to the wide variety of views that are known to exist in the community on the subject. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* One practical application of this proposition will be studies to review how the scheme provided for in this legislation is meeting the needs of the <span class="highlight">child</span>, the family and the community, and to identify inadequacies, if any. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The second expression of the Government's concern about future developments is the provision for research to explore the very large field of <span class="highlight">child</span> care, particularly as it relates to day care, and related areas such as after-school and holi-day care for school-aged children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The Government is uncommitted as to the eventual directions in which its assistance towards <span class="highlight">child</span> day care nay develop. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* One area that will inevitably attract investigation is alternative forms of <span class="highlight">child</span> day care such as family day care centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Also worthy of study is the motivation for mothers of young children to continue to care for their own children in their own homes rather than to enter paid employment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* For example, in this regard what is the persuasive influence of appropriate family counselling on mothers of young children? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* Another area that will need development is the form by which the evaluation of <span class="highlight">child</span> care arrangements may proceed. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* It may be possible to involve, say, professionally qualified social workers or sociologists experienced in the <span class="highlight">child</span> care field to work in and around the Government assisted <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721010_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-30-0)

* The grant will be calculated according to the number of hours the children in special need are cared for in the centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721024_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-33-0)

* The capital grants side of the scheme provides for unmatched capital grants to be paid direct to eligible organisations for, firstly, the purchase, erection, extension or alteration of buildings, including necessary fixtures and land cost, for use as a <span class="highlight">child</span> care centre; and. * The purpose of capital grants is to ensure that sufficient <span class="highlight">child</span> care facilities of good quality are available where they are needed most. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1972/19721024_reps_27_hor81/#subdebate-33-0)
