* For example, many have rightly wanted to see an expansion in the availability of pre-school education, whilst others have been more concerned to press for the provision of a greater number of <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The former group place emphasis on the educational needs of children, especially those in the 3 to 5 year old age group. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The latter are anxious to overcome the problem of the care of children whose parents need to work. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The tendency to distinguish between the care of the pre-school <span class="highlight">child</span> and the education of that <span class="highlight">child</span> has led to an unfortunate narrowing of public awareness and national concern. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Secondly, the distinction has often hidden the importance of special consideration being given to the needs of the very young <span class="highlight">child</span>, the <span class="highlight">child</span> 3 years of age and under. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* There is now a growing public recognition and expression of the view that there is no ideal substitute for home and family life for the young <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* At its 1974-75 annual conference the New South Wales Federation of Infant School Clubs called upon the Government 'to ensure that no pre-school <span class="highlight">child</span> is deprived of his or her mother's care for financial reasons, especially in the first 3 years '. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Most Australian families either choose to care for their pre-school age children especially those of 3 years of age and under, or would like to be able to make that choice. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The major objective of any <span class="highlight">child</span> care policy should be to make this possible for those who, through economic and social pressure, are now unable to do so. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* We must concentrate our national energies and resources not only on creating new day care facilities but also in a wide-ranging community approach to <span class="highlight">child</span> care. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* We must endorse the trend to family orientation of <span class="highlight">child</span> care by strengthening the capabilities of families with measures designed to improve their social and economic conditions. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* To do this we must recognise that there are a wide range of economic and social policies which, whilst not being <span class="highlight">child</span> care programs per se, influence the way in which children are cared for and by whom; their mothers or a substitute. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Such matters as taxation policies originally designed for a nation of single income families or taxation concessions and <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment and other benefits which have lost their real value are matters that are in need of urgent attention. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Much legislation discriminates against the normal 2-parent family and, in addition, places 2 -income families in an advantaged position when compared with those families where the wife and mother stays at home to care for her children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* More and more people are starting to realise that in both the long and the short term it is intolerable to have a situation where mother and <span class="highlight">child</span> are deprived of mother care solely for financial reasons. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* This burden can be overcome in 2 ways: Either by the mother, irrespective of the ages of her children, going to work, or by significant tax reforms so that the current discrimination against the single income family is removed. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Such suggestions included consideration of voluntary income splitting of the incomes of husband and wife; the restoration of concessional deductions for dependent spouses and dependent children to realistic levels; the restructuring of the tax scale on an overall basis; an increase in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment; and the restoration of the deduction for education expenses. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* These and many other proposals, such as some form of family income maintenance or a mothers' allowance, are deserving of detailed study and appraisal in an attempt to design a policy for the care and education of the pre-school <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It is because of the whole wide range of matters that affect the development of the young <span class="highlight">child</span> that the Opposition proposed the establishment of a children's bureau under a minister of community development. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* If families are to be given the opportunity of providing adequate home based care for their young children, measures with both direct and indirect consequences must be introduced to ensure that a real choice is available where today no real choice exists. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* This can be done in a wide variety of ways, including the encouragement of play groups and toddlers groups which provide opportunities for social interaction of mothers as well as their children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The provision of <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres available for occasional use, the suitability and availability of playgrounds together with the provision of community amenities such as libraries and toy-lending services, can also provide valuable support to a mother engaged in the full-time care of a <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* There will, however, always be those children for whom substitute care must be provided. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The Minister for Education at a seminar held at the Australian National University in 1974 said that he believed that adequate <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres need to give a <span class="highlight">child</span> responsive appreciation and predictable warmth of the type that would be available in the home. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It is to be hoped that in expanding the number of available places in <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres through local government and other community groups adequate recognition will be given to the role of the private <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres which to date have provided more than 70 per cent of care facilities. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* A pluralistic approach should be followed and the Australian Federation of <span class="highlight">Child</span> Care Associations and its constituent members should be given appropriate recognition and encouragement. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Such schemes should take their place among the whole range of <span class="highlight">child</span> care facilities and not be seen as a magic formula in looking after children who are away from their parents. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* We would have liked to find in the Bill greater emphasis both on the need for research into the care and education of pre-school children and on the importance of evaluating the effect of those programs which no doubt will be supported by the Commission. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* In providing support we think that money should be made available through the States as is the case in the fields of primary and secondary education, and that the Bill should include a provision requiring the Commission to work in close consultation and cooperation with the States in the development of comprehensive <span class="highlight">child</span> care and education programs. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Organisations which have developed a distinctive style in the provision of <span class="highlight">child</span> care facilities or education for the pre-school <span class="highlight">child</span> should not, through the imposition of strings, be required to conform to a standard method of providing care or pre-school education, provided of course that the services offered though diverse in character meet acceptable minimum standards. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* I support the Children's Commission Bill 1975 with deep personal pleasure as already I have seen the hope and enthusiasm which the proposal has given rise to within the electorate. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It is a measure that has met with public acclaim and, despite efforts by opponents of the Government to suppress the knowledge of the benefits to be gained, those concerned with <span class="highlight">child</span> care and those in public life have been able to spread the message widely. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* However, the funding of day <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres in Western Australia has been restricted in one sense by the election promise of the existing State Government to commence pre-school centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It is hoped that out of a promise made during the fervour of an election a sound and sensible State <span class="highlight">child</span> care system will evolve. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It is ironical that the very people who decry Australian Government participation have to rely in the main on the Australian Government for funds in this area of <span class="highlight">child</span> care. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Already the Interim Children's Commission has approved day care centres in areas of need. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It is hoped that the socioeconomic surveys will show where needs exist and that the appointment of catalysts or, in common terms, research and community <span class="highlight">child</span> care guidance people, will produce suitable recommendations. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* An aspect of <span class="highlight">child</span> care which alarms me is the tendency to embark on grandiose building projects without examining facilities available in the community which could be put to dual use. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* One area which concerns me relates to the latch-key <span class="highlight">child</span>- so-called for want of a better term. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* These children go to school early and leave late. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* If we are to continue to have working families and if we are to encourage working parents to raise families, then governments must make provision for the care of these children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* In my area at Bellmay an out of school <span class="highlight">child</span> care group has started a pilot project. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* But the most pleasing aspect is that it is a place where children are going because they want to go. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It is catering for children who wish to go there after school to undertake some creative hobby, thus ensuring that the children who are there because of other circumstances feel that they are not a race apart. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* But this brings about a continuing problem for those children once they leave the day care centre and enter the normal schooling stream. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* This is one reason why I suggest that there is an urgent need to make a continuing provision for such children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* There is room for a community voluntary service based on outgoing home <span class="highlight">child</span> care problems. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* This legislation highlights the fact that this is only the beginning of the <span class="highlight">child</span> care area in Australia. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* -Despite its imperfections, this Bill which seeks to establish a Children's Commission is a genuine attempt to overcome one of the major social problems arising from a technologically advanced consumer society which claims a high standard of living, therefore requiring a large percentage of its work force, both male and female, to participate fully in the production of the goods and services required by the community. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* In October 1972 the <span class="highlight">Child</span> Welfare Grants Act was passed. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* That Act provided for research grants and for funds to assist local bodies or interested groups to establish and run <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* In 1968-69 the available <span class="highlight">child</span> care facilities in Australia catered for approximately 14 000 children only- not a very high figure- and in New South Wales, my own State, in 1972, the most recent figures available, there were some 760 registered <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres coping for 39 913 children up to 5 years of age. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The estimated number of 3 and 4-year-old children in New South Wales in 1972 was over 165 000. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Thus, only 15.7 per cent of eligible children were attending pre-school in 1972. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Despite these factors married women comprise only 22 per cent of the total work force at present and 70.8 per cent of those are of <span class="highlight">child</span>-bearing age, which I take to be between 15 and 44 years. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Thus the majority of women in the <span class="highlight">child</span>-bearing category still remain at home and receive little assistance in bringing up young children. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* One of the major difficulties which Australia has faced is that for too long the need to build up a pre-school and <span class="highlight">child</span> care infrastructure, especially at the local government level, was not given the amount of attention which perhaps it should have. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Every <span class="highlight">child</span> over the age of 2Vi years was guaranteed entry into a pre-school for 6 days of the week. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* I believe it will take a long time for Australia to reach that standard but it is an objective that is worth considering very seriously especially for those children whose parents wish to or have to enter the work force. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* In view of the realities of the situation which have been emphasised, namely, that at present the existing facilities are simply not adequate to meet the existing demand, much less the anticipated demand in future years, I think the legislation is unduly short-sighted in not at this stage encouraging appropriately qualified people to enter the preschool and <span class="highlight">child</span> care area so that there will be adequate facilities to take those children whose parents wish them to be looked after. ' [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It is proposed that the Children's Commission should report directly to the Prime Minister  (Mr Whitlam). [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The Opposition is of the view, and will certainly carry it into effect when we return to the Treasury bench, that there should be established a Children's Bureau which will provide a central source of input to a committee of Ministers who will retain responsibility for the administration of programs within their respective portfolios such as those of health, education and social welfare. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The Children's Bureau will not administer programs nor control funding of them. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* In other words, the Children's Bureau will act as a collector of information and a disseminator of trends and information to the Departments of State responsible for various aspects of social welfare matters. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* On 19 February 1973-just 79 days after we had been elected- the Prime Minister  (Mr Whitlam)  announced the establishment of the Australian Pre-Schools Commission to investigate pre-schooling and <span class="highlight">child</span> care centres throughout Australia. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Thus, on 19 September 1974, the Minister assisting the Prime Minister, the Special Minister of State  (Mr Lionel Bowen),  announced the Government's wish to establish a children's commission. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* At that time, the Government set up the interim commission to look again at the whole issue of <span class="highlight">child</span> care. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It was to have as one of its broad aims the establishment of the Government's firm intention that by 1980 all children in Australia would have access to the services designed to take care of their educational, emotional, physical, social and recreational needs. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* By the setting up of this committee the Government recognised that no rigid distinction should be made between the education of children and the caring of them. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The Special Minister of State on 19 September stated that one of the real strengths of the Government's program was that it would break down the false dichotomy between <span class="highlight">child</span> care and preschooling. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The sad fact is that up till now preschooling originally intended by us as an important aid in removing or modifying inequalities of background, environment, family income and family nationality- had primarily benefited children whose mothers could afford to stay at home. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Not only has this situation put children from less privileged environments at an even greater disadvantage but also it has created a harmful distinction between the mother who stays at home and the mother who works. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The interim commission was to take charge of the 1972 <span class="highlight">Child</span> Care Act, passed in October 1972 by the Opposition when it was in government. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The spending of money must be done in relation to a number of issues- the number and sort of resources already available in the community, the effect upon the <span class="highlight">child</span> and the effect upon the parents and particularly the mother. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It should not be forgotten that it is also a basic resource in <span class="highlight">child</span> care. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* We pay people an allowance for looking after children- sometimes up to 5 children- in the person's own home. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Equipment for the children can be supplied and social workers regularly check on the situation to see how the children are and whether their needs are being met. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* The more one thinks about it the more one wonders why someone has not yet levelled the charge at us that we are nationalising <span class="highlight">child</span> minding. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* As speakers in this debate have been asked to shorten their speaking time I shall conclude my remarks by saying that this Bill should go some way towards recognising the aspirations of the community for its children and its future. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Amongst other things -  lower the admission age to the year in which the <span class="highlight">child</span> turns five. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It was also alleged by certain people who criticised him that he was reducing the funds available for other pre-school and <span class="highlight">child</span> care services. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Why he was suprised by this criticism is difficult to imagine becuase I am sure that to the casual observer it would have been clear that the State Government was trying to honour a clumsy election promise to lower the age of primary school admission, and to do this it was using Australian Government funds which in every other State were being used for the legitimate purpose of expanding pre-school and <span class="highlight">child</span> care services. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* To the extent that a large program of construction of pre-primary centres would limit the possibility for the expenditure on other <span class="highlight">child</span> care services, the criticism of the Western Australian Minister for Educaton was quite valid. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Very simply, the amendments provided for a reconstituted Pre-School Board of Western Australia and empowered it to provide both educational and <span class="highlight">child</span> care faculties for children who were over 2 years of age and who had not yet turned five. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* This allowed the Board legitimately to obtain funds from the Children's Commission for the provision of early childhood services for children under 5, which has been the stated aim of the Special Minister of State. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* I should say that the reason this situation has come about is that even though the Australian Government, through the Interim Committee for a Children's Commission did fund the preprimary centres last year the Special Minister of State  (Mr Lionel Bowen),  on a recent visit to Western Australia, indicated quite clearly that in future the Children's Commission would not fund the pre-primary program of the Western Australian Government. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Secondly, if the Australian Government commits itself to funding a preprimary program it will leave itself very little opportunity for expanding <span class="highlight">child</span> care and other services which it intends to provide throughout the country. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* It is true that the people of Western Australia are in great need of all the other sorts of services which it is intended will be provided by the Children's Commission. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1975/19750513_reps_29_hor94/#subdebate-33-0)

* Fifthly, Labor welcomes the increase in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760525_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-38-1)

* However, my sixth point is that we deplore the fact that these improvements to <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment have been carried out at the expense of so many. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760525_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-38-1)

* The Government is also providing an increase- a large increase- in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment, which will be paid to the mothers of children in areas in which there is real need and in which the private welfare agencies have said that such payment is so necessary. * I turn to the third element, namely, <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760525_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-38-1)

* Any person who has a regard for children and a love of family will desire to ensure that the mother will have a better opportunity to feed, clothe, entertain and ensure the recreation of her children. * I believe that we achieve more than that, because under the present provisions, particularly with regard to the indexation of wages and income tax supplementary to an increase in wages and <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment increases, we have established the proper basis on which we can now approach the trade union movement in order to ensure that the unions are persuaded to come to the party and agree to an incomes policy and, more particularly, a responsible wages policy. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760525_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-38-1)

* At the point of implementation of the package, that is, when tax indexation is introduced and we have the Medibank levy and the <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment and dependent children's tax rebate manoeuvre, a lot of people will be worse off. * The increase in <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment and the abolition of the tax rebates for children mean that families will have less cash in their pay envelopes. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760525_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-38-1)

* The positive sides of it in fiscal terms are the change to <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment, tax indexation- which is one of the most important changes ever introduced in Australia- and, of course, a transfer from the rebate system to a cash transfer system. * First of all I want to take the question of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment versus tax indexation. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760525_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-41-0)

* We are told that the combined cost of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment plus the tax rebate system is of the order of $ 1,021m of which something like $240m, or about one-quarter, is attributable to the <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment bill and something like three-quarters of the total cost is attributable to the tax rebate system. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760525_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-41-0)

* It is now proposed that we should introduce a <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment system that will have approximately the same total cost but will distribute the overall benefits somewhat differently. * All I suggest is that not enough credit has been given or attention paid- and I think this is implicit enough in the kind of explanation that was given in the Treasurer's speech- to what was done recently by the tax rebate system that was supposed to operate, and will operate certainly for the year ended June 1976, but will be terminated with respect to children as from 1 July 1976. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760525_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-41-0)

* The <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment proposals- moving the tax rebate for children across to <span class="highlight">child</span> endowmentI believe constitute a very good principle. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* The Government does not want to index the rebates for children which existed under the tax scheme and accordingly is moving them across to <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* I refer now to <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* It is a most generous move on behalf of the Government to increase <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment to the extent it has. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* I refer to such things as the cancellation of the rebate for dependants and its replacement with a family allowance or increased <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment payments; the disbanding of Medibank and the forced return of people to the private health insurance funds, with a slug to taxpayers to pay for it; and income tax indexation as a trade-off to the Medibank tax or the Medibank levy- call it what you will, because it is one and the same thing. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* Why did the Government decide to take away the rebate for dependent children and turn it into a family allowance or an increase in the <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* But, of course, the Government is not indexing the <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment payments. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* It refused to index the rebates for dependents, and we will not see it index the new <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment payments. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* <span class="highlight">Child</span> endowment payments are paid into the banks, and I think it is true to say that many mothers will leave the money there as a nest egg, call it what you will. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* At any time in the future that the Government may want to increase <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment payments it can add to consumer stimulus by doing so. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* There will be an increase in demand for <span class="highlight">child</span> care services but a decrease in the funds available to meet this demand. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* To the people who make these kinds of criticisms about poor people and large families, I say that it is morally questionable to suggest that the capacity or incentive to have children should be judged solely by pecuniary considerations. * To those who put forward these criticisms, I say that their argument means that to deny these poor people assistance is like shutting the gate after the horse has bolted and the children would suffer the consequences if adequate government assistance were not available to compensate them for their parents' amorous activities. * Further, I ask: Who is entitled to say that certain people can have children and certain people cannot? [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* Surely in a country such as Australia anyone who wants to have children is entitled to have them and governments must ensure that their policies are structured in such a way as to permit this. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* It also should be pointed out that 58 per cent of the <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment payments are currently paid directly into bank accounts. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* The payment of water and municipal rates and the re-equipment of children going back to school, plus the cost of the Christmas lay-off, all happened to fall within that period. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* On the subject of <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment the report states: [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1976/19760526_reps_30_hor99/#subdebate-26-0)

* The Government increased <span class="highlight">child</span> endowment; that is true. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1977/19770920_reps_30_hor106/#subdebate-28-0)

* If a <span class="highlight">child</span> has to attend a hospital considerable expense for the parent to be near the <span class="highlight">child</span> is involved. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1977/19770920_reps_30_hor106/#subdebate-28-0)

* The word custody usually refers to the situation after a court has determined a dispute: The parent having custody is the one who lives with and looks after the <span class="highlight">child</span> from day to day, and makes most of the decisions affecting his life. * So too will income from the investment of other sums coming directly to a <span class="highlight">child</span> on a person 's death, such as the proceeds of a life insurance policy or a lump sum from a superannuation fund. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1979/19791122_reps_31_hor116/#subdebate-45-0)

* Income from property transferred to a <span class="highlight">child</span> by another person to whom the property was left by a deceased person, if transferred within three years after the death of that person, will be excluded if within limits set by relevant rules of intestacy. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1979/19791122_reps_31_hor116/#subdebate-45-0)

* A <span class="highlight">child</span> in full time employment will, of course, be outside the new system altogether but, as regards a <span class="highlight">child</span> not categorically excluded in this way, employment income from part time work and income from a business conducted by the <span class="highlight">child</span> alone or with another minor will both be outside the new system. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1979/19791122_reps_31_hor116/#subdebate-45-0)

* Income from court-ordered settlements arising as a result of divorce or judicial separation, income from the investment of a <span class="highlight">child</span>'s lottery winnings and income from the investment of savings out of any of the excluded categories of income make up the balance of the classes of income excluded from the new system. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1979/19791122_reps_31_hor116/#subdebate-45-0)

* These safeguarding measures aim to ensure, for example, that profits are not diverted to a <span class="highlight">child</span> 's business by relatives or other persons not at arm's length, and that income from a <span class="highlight">child</span>'s investment is not inflated by similar diversions. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1979/19791122_reps_31_hor116/#subdebate-45-0)

* Trust income to which a <span class="highlight">child</span> under 18 years of age is, or is deemed to be, presently entitled is already taxable in the trustee's hands and will be taxed under the new system on the same basis as would apply if the <span class="highlight">child</span> derived the income directly. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1979/19791122_reps_31_hor116/#subdebate-45-0)

* It is to the effect that a <span class="highlight">child</span>, or the trustee for a <span class="highlight">child</span>, will be eligible for a rebate to the extent that the tax otherwise payable on the relevant eligible income is greater than the tax that would have been payable on that income if it had been derived by the parent, or the parent with the higher taxable income. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1979/19791122_reps_31_hor116/#subdebate-45-0)

* If the <span class="highlight">child</span> has minor brothers or sisters also in receipt of eligible income, the eligible incomes of all of them will be added to that of the relevant parent in ascertaining how much tax the income would have borne in the parent's hands. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1979/19791122_reps_31_hor116/#subdebate-45-0)

* Where there are children these limits are increased by $6 for each <span class="highlight">child</span>. [[More&hellip;]](https://historichansard.net/hofreps/1979/19791122_reps_31_hor116/#subdebate-55-23)
